DOC.brief_summary: This is a study of plasma HBP -levels of a previously published trial of G-CSF in critically ill patients (Pettila et al. Critical Care Medicine 2000). The original study was a prospective, randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of filgrastim in patients with acute respiratory failure requiring intubation. In this substudy, the investigators evaluated the effect of filgrastim on HBP -concentrations in critically ill patients.
DOC.brief_title: Heparin Binding Protein in Patients With Acute Respiratory Failure Treated With GCSF (Filgrastim)
DOC.criteria: Criteria for original study. For the substudy, all these patients were included. Age > 18 years Admitted to the ICU no longer than 12 hrs before study entry Intubated because of ventilation insufficiency no longer than 48 hrs before study entry Clinically expected stay in the ICU > 48 hrs Informed consent Pregnant or nursing Total leukocyte count of > 50,000/mm3 Administration of filgrastim, sargramostim, or other biological response modifiers within 7 days before study entry Known hypersensitivity or allergic reaction to Escherichia coliderived products Participation in another drug study
